params.text:
Add instruction for allocating local registers

Currently the "frame" instruction is responsible for allocating local
registers. This kinda-sorta makes sense, but... it doesn't.
Frame allocated externally-visible registers: the ones holding the
parameters of the function. It is OK, because the caller must be
aware of the number of parameters a function takes.

It does not make sense for the caller to be aware of the number of
local registers its callee uses because it's an implementation detail.
Also, allocating local registers in "frame" instruction means that if
a function will become more "register hungry" in a newer version of a
library, but its number of parameters does not change, the calling
code has to be recompiled.
This is madness!
